content:
Instead of showing 25+ user's list, we should show less of them (probably top 10 most frequent one). That will save a lot of space in the bottom right which we could use in showing other stuff.

pasted image

I just heard a suggest to do something like skype does: tabs for a contacts list and recent conversations
maybe this way the whole contacts list could be move to the left side and the user can switch between contacts and streams. There was a discussion before about the right side bar and group PMs as well. So alternatively the right side bar remains but the tabs would be contacts and the recent group PMs (when it is redone).
2017-05-22_13-25-44.gif
@Brock Whittaker was this something that you had in mind?
I was thinking more like having something similar to the pinned streams (where they are separated by an <hr>), for design uniformity.
We just switched the right sidebar user list to use perfectScrollbar; I'd love it if a few folks played around with it and tried to see if there's any corner cases that don't work.
deployed, I assume?
yep!
It seems like I can only activate the wide scrollbar if I mousewheel first.
Hmmm, maybe that's not the exact problem, but it feels like I have to hover in just the right way to get it in a nice mouse-scrolling mode.
I think maybe the bug is that it disappears if you add a filter until you mousewheel?
There's an orange line on the side that attracts your eye, but you have to hover over the gray to get a nice mouse-grab target.
I think that's probably a missing .update() call somewhere. Might be the same as https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/6738, which I just opened.
Orange? I definitely don't see any orange...
pasted image
Hmm, is that orange actually the native browser scrollbar for the message feed (which is just to the right of the user list scrollbar)?
FF/ubuntu
hmmm, yep
I don't think that's the right side userlist scrollbar at all
both are skinny as heck and right on top of each other
Right, so the intended fix here is that we should move the user list scrollbar. For now, it's effectively hidden.
and it's obviously at least plausibly unintuitive that the rightmost scrollbar controls the leftmost list
Hmm, now I'm wondering whether a nice intermediate step would be to just make the "main app" scrollbar invisible, before we move it somewhere good.
Not the leftmost, the middle one :)
the leftmost of the two lists we're talking about :)
Yeah. Is that behavior worse than it was before?
Or just "we didn't fix the main message feed scrollbar"
no
OK
So I think the main thing we've found so far for @Brock Whittaker to investigate is that typing in the users search seems to not update the scrollbar properly.
I don't notice any problems here that probably weren't already existing at some level.
(so I'm definitely in favor of letting the current changes stay and we just keep iterating)
Yeah, that's my thought as well.
Looks like scrolling through the message list produces a scrollbar that hits the top navbar when you scroll to the top of a narrow?

@Cynthia Lin I'm not sure I understand your comment, but I think that's the behavior we've always had with the outer scrollbar (for the message feed). So far all we've changed is the user list scrollbar.
Do you think this behavior is worth fixing?

This is what it looks like if you set the z-index of the top navbar to the top so the scrollbar doesn't cover it; not sure if this is an optimal fix for the bug though
Screenshot-at-Sep-28-10-28-10.png
For reference here is current behavior Screenshot-at-Sep-28-10-28-28.png
Ahh, I see the problem. @Brock Whittaker what do you think?

Hm. If we are planning on moving the scrollbar to the message pane and changing to perfectScrollbar then I wouldn't worry about this, but I don't know if I like the concept of a scrollbar getting obscured by something.
It looks "broken".
That said it's probably not great that it can scroll up there anyways. It should ideally hit the bottom of the navbar and stop.
It also doesn't seem to always be triggering the "show" event properly when you move the mouse into the users list.
s/properly/consistently/. If I move the mouse, it doesn't appear. I sometimes need to scroll slightly with the mouse wheel.
I can reproduce what @Robert is saying.(Firefox on ubuntu)
Are these problems worth creating a single issue for? There are at least 3 different bugs with the right sidebar scrollbar that I've recently seen
Yeah, I think a single issue makes sense here, since there may be interactions between fixes.
Yeah, sounds good.
@Brock Whittaker is I think working on it.
yeah lmk what the problems are because they may have been fixed yesterday on master when the scrollbar fixes were merged.
Let me do a deploy here.
OK, deployed master. At least some of the bugs we were discussing are fixed.
(Specifically, the issues about the scrollbar updating properly when you filter)
@Robert @Harshit Bansal @Cynthia Lin can you see if you can reproduce the problems you were seeing?
The scrollbar is now immediately showing up when I hover over the users list.
Kind of cool how it starts narrow, then gets wider when you get closer.
Now I am unable to use the message feed scrollbar at all.(firefox on ubuntu)
How about the user list scrollbar?
That is working fine.
OK. So I guess we should try to move that other scrollbar sooner rather than later.

1. Quickly switching between scrolling over message panel and user lists still results in overlapping scrollbars
2. Message panel scrollbar still hits and crosses over top navbar when I scroll to top of the message feed
Makes sense. Is issue 2 reproducible in 1.6 (e.g. on zulip.sagemath.org)? Basically, the message panel scrollbar needs work, but I'm wondering if it's any worse than before.
Both are reproducible on 1.6

I test-deployed #7246 by @Shubham Dhama, which changes the right sidebar to no longer have the little caret menus and instead just pop up the users popovers when one clicks there. The one thing that I think still needs work is what should happen with the right sidebar keyboard interactions -- if you filter the list and hit enter, should it start a PM to that user (as it does today), or pop up the user's profile popover?
I would recommend opening the profile popover and then using the (R) shortcut that was being discussed recently.
perhaps if there are unreads, it should just open the PM?
Opening the PM is what it does right now; so if we like that, we can keep it.
right now meaning, pre the current deploy?

I'm personally not a big fan of this change as its counter-intuitive because of the cost of two clicks to get PMs and difference between the behavior on click stream in left sidebar and user in the right sidebar. Our current behavior(in master) is what someone expects first time.

I'm in favor of the new change as is, but my suggestion would be to make the next step more obvious, by making one of the more menu options more prominent (perhaps moving the divider). A wording change might also help ("Start chatting" or something).

pasted image

yeah, I agree with Shubham that it's nice to have the entries on the right sidebar match the left sidebar, and also to match the behavior of the Group PMs in the bottom right. It's possible we'll also want a setting to merge the right sidebar into the left sidebar.
one possibility could be to have clicking on the person open the PM as usual, but move the chevron to the left of the name, so that it's closer to the mouse
I don't think the chevron to the left of the name would work visually.
I sorta agree that it feels a bit counter-intuitive that it's now 2 clicks to get to see PMs.
This feature has been kinda driving me crazy catching up on all my PM threads, so I think it's time to remove it. Doing a deploy now.
Chevron on the left. We can make it pretty.:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Barring new ideas, I think this is a failed experiment. I think the next thing to try is replacing the chevron with another icon that better suggests this is that user's profile.
(I guess one idea would be to make the presence icon more of a person-outline, and then have that be what you click)
Agree on failed experiment but I am glad we tried it!
Experimenting with presence icons sounds cool!! slight Increase in size on hover and slight darken color to make it feel to get clicked.

Moving conversation to here (https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/7246#issuecomment-370036586), I played with the presence icon and with simple CSS something like this can be made, though I'm not someone against arrow :) presence-icon-which-grows-with-hover-and-shows-popover-on-clicking.gif
hm, I'd say it's not quite there yet. Maybe try something closer to box shadow than growing the icon size?
Yup that looks more intuitive: Version-2.gif
Hover.png Many-User.gif
Another thing that I think is worth fixing is position of popover when clicked from right-sidebar.
hm, I think still doesn't quite suggest click target strongly enough. Is it easy to experiment with moving the chevron to the left side, and replacing it with 3 vertical dots?
Some other(but don't look great) 11.gif 12.gif 14.gif 13.gif
And here are those which I think you're referring: Horizontal-Required.gif Vertical-Required.gif

Thanks! A few thoughts

  • It should definitely appear only on hover, as in your last examples
  • Vertical is better than horizontal
  • There are possibly nicer dots we can find? But we can work on that later
  • The dots should be at a lower opacity until you hover over them (you can copy the CSS for the chevron)
  • Let's try the dots appearing to the left of the circles, not replacing them?
